warmup_exercises.setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended to the sides.
warmup_exercises.execution: Make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup: Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution: Rotate your shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.
Slowly straighten your arms and lift your chest, holding for 15 seconds. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, placing your hand behind your head.
warmup_exercises.execution: Use your other hand to gently pull your elbow closer to your head, holding for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side. Repeat 2 times.

warmup_exercises.setup: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Repeat for 1 minute.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so your back is comfortably supported.  Grab the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip. Ensure your elbows are slightly bent at the starting position.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably with your back against the backrest, feet flat on the floor. Grab the handles, ensuring a secure grip.
2. The Press: Extend your arms fully, pushing the handles away from your chest. Keep your core engaged and maintain a controlled movement.
3. The Return: Slowly return the handles to your chest, feeling a deep stretch in your pectoral muscles. Avoid letting the weight slam against your chest.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, but challenges you on the last 2 reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip. Lower the bar to your chest, ensuring it touches.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width. Lower the bar to your chest.
2. The Press: Keeping your core engaged, press the bar upwards until your arms are fully extended. Maintain a controlled movement.
3. The Return: Slowly lower the bar back to your chest, ensuring a controlled descent. Avoid letting the bar slam against your chest.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 8 repetitions with proper form, ensuring a challenging yet manageable weight.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to lift the weight.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring a secure grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring a secure grip. Lower the dumbbells to your chest.
2. The Press: Keeping your core engaged, press the dumbbells upwards until your arms are fully extended. Maintain a controlled movement.
3. The Return: Slowly lower the dumbbells back to your chest, ensuring a controlled descent. Avoid letting the dumbbells slam against your chest.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, focusing on controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a comfortable height. Sit on the seat, ensuring your back is straight. Grab the handles, ensuring a secure grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably with your back straight. Grab the handles, ensuring a secure grip. Extend your arms fully in front of you.
2. The Fly: Keeping your elbows slightly bent, slowly bring the handles together in front of your chest, feeling a stretch in your pectoral muscles.
3. The Return: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 10 repetitions with good form, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Sit down on the seat of the cable fly machine, ensuring your back is straight and supported. Grab the handles with a comfortable grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Extend your arms fully in front of you, holding the handles.
2. The Fly: Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, slowly bring the handles together in front of your chest, feeling a stretch in your pectoral muscles.
3. The Return: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 12 repetitions with good form, focusing on controlled movements and a full range of motion.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring a secure grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Extend your arms fully to the sides.
2. The Fly: Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, slowly bring the dumbbells together in front of your chest, feeling a stretch in your pectoral muscles.
3. The Return: Slowly return the dumbbells to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 12 repetitions with good form, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to lift the weight.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly closer than shoulder-width, ensuring a secure grip. Lower the bar to your chest, ensuring it touches.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Lower the bar to your chest.
2. The Press: Keeping your core engaged, press the bar upwards until your arms are fully extended. Maintain a controlled movement.
3. The Return: Slowly lower the bar back to your chest, ensuring a controlled descent. Avoid letting the bar slam against your chest.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, but challenges you on the last 2 reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's low pulley. Stand facing the machine, gripping the bar with an overhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grip the bar with an overhand grip.
2. The Press Down: Keeping your elbows close to your sides, extend your arms downwards, pushing the bar away from your body.
3. The Return: Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 8 repetitions with proper form, ensuring a challenging yet manageable weight.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to lift the weight.

exercises.setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's high pulley. Stand facing away from the machine with your arms fully extended overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with your arms fully extended overhead, holding the bar with an overhand grip.
2. The Extension: Keeping your elbows close to your head, slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows.
3. The Return: Extend your arms back to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, focusing on controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Extend your arms fully overhead.
2. The Extension: Keeping your elbows close to your head, slowly lower the bar towards your forehead by bending your elbows.
3. The Return: Extend your arms back to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 10 repetitions with good form, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to lift the weight.

exercises.setup: Attach a rope attachment to the cable machine's high pulley. Stand facing away from the machine with your arms fully extended overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with your arms fully extended overhead, holding the rope attachment.
2. The Extension: Keeping your elbows close to your head, slowly lower the rope behind your head by bending your elbows.  Squeeze your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. The Return: Extend your arms back to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 12 repetitions with good form, focusing on controlled movements and a full range of motion.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Hold a dumbbell in one hand. Lean forward, supporting yourself with your other hand on a bench or your knee.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lean forward, supporting yourself with your other hand on a bench or your knee. Hold a dumbbell in one hand, arm extended down.
2. The Extension: Keeping your elbow close to your body, extend your arm upwards, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
3. The Return: Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions on one arm, then switch to the other arm.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 12 repetitions with good form, maintaining tension throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion. Avoid using momentum to lift the weight.
